ipi-pcep:pcep.description: Generic configuration and operational model for PCEP entity

config.description: Configuration data of the PCEP entity on the device

entity-id.description: This attribute is used to configure PCEP Entity.

keep-alive-interval.description: This attribute is used to set the keep alive transmission timer that this PCEP entity will propose in the initial OPEN message of each session it is involved in. This is the maximum time between two consecutive messages sent to a peer. Zero means that the PCEP entity prefers not to send Keepalives at all.

dead-interval.description: This attribute is used to set the dead timer that this PCEP entity will propose in the initial OPEN message of each session it is involved in. This is the time after which a peer should declare a session down if it does not receive any PCEP messages.

request-timeout.description: This attribute is used to set the maximum time that the PCEP entity will wait for a response to a PCReq message.

tolerance-keepalive.description: This attribute is used to set the tolerance value for keep-alive timer.

tolerance-dead-interval.description: This attribute is used to set the tolerance value for dead interval timer.

cool-off-timeout.description: This attribute is used to set Flap dampening time.

source-address.description: This attribute is used to configure the local Internet address of this PCEP entity. If operating as a PCE server, the PCEP entity listens on this address. If operating as a PCC, the PCEP entity binds outgoing TCP connections to this address. It is possible for the PCEP entity to operate both as a PCC and a PCE Server, in which case it uses this address both to listen for incoming TCP connections and to bind outgoing TCP connections.

recovery-policy.description: This attribute is used to configure delegation recovery policy.

state.description: Operational state data of the PCEP entity on the device

entity-id.description: This attribute is used to configure PCEP Entity.

keep-alive-interval.description: This attribute is used to set the keep alive transmission timer that this PCEP entity will propose in the initial OPEN message of each session it is involved in. This is the maximum time between two consecutive messages sent to a peer. Zero means that the PCEP entity prefers not to send Keepalives at all.

dead-interval.description: This attribute is used to set the dead timer that this PCEP entity will propose in the initial OPEN message of each session it is involved in. This is the time after which a peer should declare a session down if it does not receive any PCEP messages.

request-timeout.description: This attribute is used to set the maximum time that the PCEP entity will wait for a response to a PCReq message.

tolerance-keepalive.description: This attribute is used to set the tolerance value for keep-alive timer.

tolerance-dead-interval.description: This attribute is used to set the tolerance value for dead interval timer.

cool-off-timeout.description: This attribute is used to set Flap dampening time.

source-address.description: This attribute is used to configure the local Internet address of this PCEP entity. If operating as a PCE server, the PCEP entity listens on this address. If operating as a PCC, the PCEP entity binds outgoing TCP connections to this address. It is possible for the PCEP entity to operate both as a PCC and a PCE Server, in which case it uses this address both to listen for incoming TCP connections and to bind outgoing TCP connections.

recovery-policy.description: This attribute is used to configure delegation recovery policy.

role.description: The role that this entity can play. Takes one of the following values. - unknown(0): this PCEP Entity role is not known. - pcc(1): this PCEP Entity is a PCC. - pce(2): this PCEP Entity is a PCE. - pcc-and-pce(3): this PCEP Entity is both a PCC and a PCE.

connect-timer.description: The time in seconds that the PCEP entity will wait to establish a TCP connection with a peer. If a TCP connection is not established within this time then PCEP aborts the session setup attempt.

connect-max-retry.description: The maximum number of times the system tries to establish a TCP connection to a peer before the session with the peer transitions to the idle state.

init-backoff-timer.description: The initial back-off time in seconds for retrying a failed session setup attempt to a peer. The back-off time increases for each failed session setup attempt, until a maximum back-off time is reached. The maximum back-off time is max-backoff-timer.

max-backoff-timer.description: The maximum back-off time in seconds for retrying a failed session setup attempt to a peer. The back-off time increases for each failed session setup attempt, until this maximum value is reached. Session setup attempts then repeat periodically without any further increase in back-off time.

open-wait-timer.description: The time in seconds that the PCEP entity will wait to receive an Open message from a peer after the TCP connection has come up. If no Open message is received within this time then PCEP terminates the TCP connection and deletes the associated sessions.

keep-wait-timer.description: The time in seconds that the PCEP entity will wait to receive a Keepalive or PCErr message from a peer during session initialization after receiving an Open message. If no Keepalive or PCErr message is received within this time then PCEP terminates the TCP connection and deletes the associated sessions.

capability.description: The PCEP entity capability information of local PCEP entity

config.description: Configuration data relevant to PCE selection

pce-instantiate.description: This attribute is used to enable PCE-initiated LSP capability.

segment-routing.description: This attribute is used to enable segment-routing capability.

segment-routing-v6.description: This attribute is used to enable segment-routing ipv6 capability.

state.description: Operational state data of local PCEP entity

pce-instantiate.description: This attribute is used to enable PCE-initiated LSP capability.

segment-routing.description: This attribute is used to enable segment-routing capability.

segment-routing-v6.description: This attribute is used to enable segment-routing ipv6 capability.

config.description: Configuration data for stateful PCE parameters

redelegation-timeout.description: This attribute is used to set the time period a PCC waits before revoking LSP delegation to a PCE and attempting to redelegate LSPs associated with the terminated PCEP session to an alternate PCE.

lsp-state-timeout.description: This attribute is used to set the time period a PCC waits before flushing LSP state associated with the terminated PCEP session and reverting to operator-defined default parameters or behaviours.

state.description: Operational state data for stateful PCE parameters

redelegation-timeout.description: This attribute is used to set the time period a PCC waits before revoking LSP delegation to a PCE and attempting to redelegate LSPs associated with the terminated PCEP session to an alternate PCE.

lsp-state-timeout.description: This attribute is used to set the time period a PCC waits before flushing LSP state associated with the terminated PCEP session and reverting to operator-defined default parameters or behaviours.

flap-count.description: This attribute is used to set the number of flaps allowed.

flap-interval.description: This attribute is used to set the flap interval time.

flap-count.description: This attribute is used to set the number of flaps allowed.

flap-interval.description: This attribute is used to set the flap interval time.

count.description: This attribute is used to set the number of allowed updates.

interval.description: This attribute is used to set time unit for updates dampening.

count.description: This attribute is used to set the number of allowed updates.

interval.description: This attribute is used to set time unit for updates dampening.

ingress-tunnel.description: List of all operational ingress LSP in the association

lsp.description: This container defines the LSP specific information

state.description: This container defined the LSP specific state

lsp-id.description: Identifier in the SENDER_TEMPLATE and the FILTER_SPEC that can be changed to allow a sender to share resources with itself.

binding-label-status.description: This container defines the Binding Label details for the LSP

state.description: This container defined the Binding label details for the computated    LSP state

tunnel-id.description: Tunnel identifier used in the session that remains constant over the life of the tunnel.

source.description: Tunnel sender address extracted from SENDER_TEMPLATE object.

destination.description: Tunnel endpoint address extracted from SESSION object.

extended-tunnel-id.description: Extended tunnel ID of the LSP.

admin-state.description: Set to true, if desired operational state is active.

symbolic-name.description: Symbolic path name associated with the LSP.

local-policy-active.description: If set, Tunnel Local Policy is in effect

request-id.description: Path request identification of the tunnel.

recent-lsp-id.description: Recent lsp-id of tunnel with TE metric configured.

pending-updates.description: If set, pending updates are available to for this tunnel.

enabled.description: Whether the LSP is delegated or not.

address.description: The PCC, the reference to the PCEP peer to which LSP is delegated; at the PCE, the reference to the PCEP peer which delegated this LSP.

stateful-request-parameter-id.description: Last SRP-ID-number associated with this LSP.

enabled.description: Set to true if this LSP is initiated by a PCE.

address.description: The PCC, the reference to the PCEP peer that initiated this LSP; at the PCE, the reference to the PCEP peer where the LSP is initiated.

peers.description: Top level container for PCEP peers

peer.description: The list of configured peers for the entity (remote PCE)

address.description: The local Internet address of this PCEP peer.
The local Internet address of this PCEP peer.
The local Internet address of this PCEP peer.

role.description: The role of the PCEP Peer. Takes one of the following values. - unknown(0): this PCEP peer role is not known. - pcc(1): this PCEP peer is a PCC. - pce(2): this PCEP peer is a PCE. - pcc-and-pce(3): this PCEP peer is both a PCC and a PCE.

session-exists.description: Indicates whether a session with this peer currently exists.

session-up-time.description: The timestamp value of the last time a session with this peer was successfully established.

session-fail-time.description: The timestamp value of the last time a session with this peer failed to be established.

counters.description: Gather the statistics for sent and received PCEP messages

tx-reports.description: Number of LSP Reports sent.A LSP report corresponds 1:1 with an LSP object in a PCRpt message. This might be greater than num-pcrpt-sent because multiple reports can be batched into a single PCRpt message.

rx-lsp-initiate.description: The number of LSP Initiation received from PCE. A LSP initiation corresponds 1:1 with an LSP object in a PCInitiate message. This might be greater than num-pcinitiate-rcvd because multiple initiations can be batched into a single PCInitiate message.

session-setup-fail.description: The number of PCEP sessions with the peer that have been attempted but failed before being fully established.

tx-open-message.description: Number of PCReq or PCRep messages sent.

tx-path-request.description: Number of path request messages sent.

tx-request.description: Number of path request objects sent.

tx-request-for-pending-reply.description: Number of requests that have been sent for which a response is still pending.

tx-request-for-error-received.description: Number of requests that were rejected with a PCErr message.

tx-request-for-nopath-receive.description: Number of requests that have been sent for which a response with a NO-PATH object was received.

tx-request-for-cancel-receive.description: Number of requests that were cancelled with a PCNtf message and number of requests that were received from the peer and explicitly cancelled by the peer sending a PCNtf.

tx-request-for-ero-received.description: Number of requests that were cancelled with a PCNtf message.

tx-request-timed-out.description: Number of requests that have been sent to a peer and have been abandoned because the peer has taken too long to respond to them.

tx-request-sent-cancel-sent.description: Number of requests that were sent to the peer and explicitly cancelled by the local PCEP entity sending a PCNotification.

tx-request-sent-closed.description: The number of requests that were sent to the peer and implicitly cancelled when the session they were sent over was closed.

rx-open-message.description: Number of PCReq or PCRep messages received.

rx-corrupt.description: Number of corrupted PCEP message received.

session.description: The entry represents a single PCEP     session in which the local    PCEP entity participates.

initiator.description: Initiator of the session,that is, whether the TCP connection was initiated by the local PCEP entity or the peer.

state.description: The current state of the session. The set of possible states excludes the idle state since entries do not exist in the idle state.

state-changes.description: The number of times session state change happended.

state-last-change.description: The timestamp value at the time this session entered its current state as denoted by the state leaf.

creation-time.description: Timestamp value at the time this session was created.

connect-retry.description: The number of times that the local PCEP entity has attempted to establish a TCP connection for this session without success. The PCEP entity gives up when this reaches connect-max-retry.

open-retry.description: The number of times that the local PCEP entity has attempted to send open message for this session without success.

local-id.description: The value of the PCEP session ID used by the local PCEP entity in the Open message for this session. If state is tcp-pending then this is the session ID that will be used in the Open message. Otherwise, this is the session ID that was sent in the Open message.

remote-id.description: The value of the PCEP session ID used by the peer in its Open message for this session.

peer-overloaded.description: If the peer has informed the local PCEP entity that it is currently overloaded, then this is set to true. Otherwise, it is set to false.

peer-overload-time.description: The interval of time that is remaining until the peer will cease to be overloaded. If it is not known how long the peer will stay in overloaded state, this leaf is set to zero.

keepalive-timer.description: The agreed maximum interval at which the local PCEP entity transmits PCEP messages on this PCEP session. Zero means that the local PCEP entity never sends Keepalives on this session.

peer-keepalive-timer.description: The agreed maximum interval at which the peer transmits PCEP messages on this PCEP session. Zero means that the peer never sends Keepalives on this session.

dead-timer.description: Dead timer interval for this PCEP session.

peer-dead-timer.description: The peer's dead-timer interval for this PCEP session.

keepalive-hold-timer-remain.description: The keep alive hold time remaining for this session.

max-unknown-message.description: Maximum number of unknown messages that any session on this PCEP entity is willing to accept per minute.

init-lsp-limit.description: LSP state associated with that PCEP session

config.description: Configuration data with resect to PCE session

lsp-limit.description: This attribute is used to set the starting Tunnel-id range for the PCE initiated LSP.
This attribute is used to set the starting Tunnel-id range for the PCE initiated LSP.

options.description: This attribute is used to enable/disable PCEP debug logs.
This attribute is used to enable/disable PCEP debug logs.

config.description: Configuration data for PCEP SRv6 spirent compliance parameters

srv6-spirent-comp.description: This attribute is used to enable/disable PCEP SRv6 spirent TLV value compliance.

state.description: Operational data for PCEP SRv6 spirent compliance parameters

srv6-spirent-comp.description: This attribute is used to enable/disable PCEP SRv6 spirent TLV value compliance.
